meanings.definition: Small balls of a strong-smelling substance used to repel moths.
meanings.sent1: I placed mothballs in my closet to keep moths away.
meanings.sent2: The old chest was filled with mothballs to protect the clothes.
meanings.sent3: The moths were so offended by the mothballs' smell, they decided to move out.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like mothballs, driving away any doubts.
meanings.sent5: The pungent odor of mothballs lingered in the air, a reminder of protection.

meanings.definition: To store or treat with mothballs.
meanings.sent1: She decided to mothball her winter clothes until next year.
meanings.sent2: The attic was mothballed to prevent moth damage.
meanings.sent3: The idea to mothball the old books seemed silly at first, but it worked.
meanings.sent4: He mothballs his memories, preserving them for the future.
meanings.sent5: The decision to mothball the project was made to focus on more urgent matters.
